lines.line: Hello there.
Hey! Don't call me outerlander! I'm known as the mighty !
Can't say I've heard of you. So they let your sort into the clan nowadays? Wow. Things have really changed since I've been gone...
You don't look like a Fremennik yourself...
Yes, I suppose that's true... I have been gone such a long time...
You've been away from these parts a while?
Oh, you haven't heard of the infamous Lokar, scourge of the northern seas?
Erm... no... That's you then, is it?
Forgotten already? Tch! I have no regrets about why I left!
Why did you leave?
As a young man, I learnt that the Fremennik way of life was too slow for me...
Oh, sure, every so often we got to go on big raiding parties, looting and pillaging the weaker islands around here for food and profit, but...
Well, after a while, that was all I looked forward to doing.
Growing crops, milking cows, catching and cooking food, the day to day activities of our life...
THEY'RE SO BORING!
No, I knew what I wanted to do, and that was attack innocent people going about their daily business, steal all their money, then spend it on wine, women and song!
Oh.... Kaaaaay....
So I ran away from Rellekka to become a PIRATE! It's way more fun. Plus you get to see the world!
Was the world good then? Only, you seem to have returned to Rellekka after all.
Yes, I have returned here, but that's only because we're short on supplies.
I see. So where are you and your scurvy sea-dogs headed to next? Arrr shiver-me timbers!
You're trying my patience...
Sorry, got caught up in the moment.
Indeed. Well, the rest of the group are at Lunar Isle at the moment. It's where the Moon Clan live.
The Moon Clan... I think I've heard of them...
I'd be surprised if you hadn't, they're the Fremenniks' most hated enemy!
They've been at war with them for hundreds of years!
Hmmm. Actually, that might be a problem for you then.
A problem?
Yeah, they're a really powerful race of mages. They'd read your mind and see that you're a Fremennik straight away, then probably turn you inside out and feed you to the birds.
Cosmic.
But you went there okay?
Yeah, but I think the Fremenniks are a bunch of losers. They probably picked up on that.
Look, I know a way you'll be able to travel there without, you know, getting killed and that, if you fancy a trip!
Why not, I've always wondered what the state of my innards are!
That's the spirit!
Well, what you want to do is go and talk to Brundt the Chieftain and get a Seal of Passage from him.
A Seal of Passage? What's that?
Well, it shows that you're a diplomat for the Fremennik, so you'll have immunity from being killed and stuff.

It's an ancient tradition not to attack anyone bearing a Seal of Passage, because they're probably on a diplomatic mission. Or well connected with powerful allies. Either way, killing them is usually a bad idea.
So I have to try and bring peace to two warring nations who have been fighting for centuries?!?!
What? I never said you had to bother trying to do that, you just have to pretend like you might.
No skin off my nose if those losers want to get slaughtered by the Moon Clan, just more stuff for me to loot when they're all dead.
Well I will try. I am the mighty after all!
Yes....
So I just have to go talk to Brundt the Chieftain and tell him I want a Seal of Passage?
That's it? Because in my experience simple tasks like that always seem to take longer than I expect...
Yeah, just go over and talk to the chief loser. You might have to tell him some rubbish he wants to hear, but that's it.
Come back here when you got it, my supplies are loaded and I'm good to head back to our ship.
Okay, I'll be right back.
No thanks, I'd like to live.
Oh, so you're a loser like the rest of the Fremenniks then? See ya around, loser.
Well, 'bye then.
Hey there. So you get that seal thingy off of the Brundt the Chieftain yet?
No... Not yet...
Well hurry it up, okay? I'm sick of this dump of a town, I want to go back to the ship!
Hi there Brundt the Chieftain. Could you help me out with a Seal of Passage?
A Seal of Passage? Whatever for?
Well, I've heard that there have been great troubles between your people and that of the Moon Clan. I was hoping to help. And so I need the Seal of Passage to show my intentions.
Ah, many have tried, but The Moon Clan are by no means a sharing group of people. They do everything by magic, something we never use. But they are so secretive about it. If only they would share, we
wouldn't have to kill them all the time!
I will see what I can do.
Can I have that seal then?
Yes, but you have no room to carry it. You should have thought of that before, !
If you are to bring peace to our two warring clans, then perhaps it is best that you do...
Hi there.
Yes?
I lost my Seal of Passage!
So you want another one?
Well... I would if I had space to carry one.
Oh dear...
Then you had better take a replacement and be less careless in future.
Ah,. How goes the peace talks with the accursed Moon Clan?
Oh, you know. Ongoing negotiations.
I see. Well, I don't hold out for much hope!
I'm glad you're confident in my abilities.
So you got that seal yet from Brundt the Chieftain? Can I leave this dump of a town?
Uh... yeah... Well, Brundt the Chieftain gave me a seal, but I think I lost it somewhere along the way...
What are you? Useless? Go get another one from Brundt the Chieftain, and hurry it up, I don't want to be here any longer than I have to be!
Yup, I've got it right here!
Great! Then let's head back to my ship! You ready to go now?
Arrr! Yar! Let's be on our way, yar!
...Why are you talking like that?
Um... isn't that how pirates talk?
Only the very stupid ones...
I suggest you DON'T talk like that to my crew. They will probably assume you are mocking them and kill you.
So let's start again: Are you ready to go?
Why yes! Tally-ho!
I suppose that will have to do.
Here we are at the Pirates' Cove! You'll find the captain already on board.
Not just yet...
Well hurry it up okay? This place is a dump, and I'm a vicious blood-thirsty pirate, not your personal travel agent.
Hello again Lokar.
Hi again ! What can I do for you?
Do I still need the Seal of Passage?
Yeah, why?
I lost it.
Silly you. You'll have to go back to Brundt the Chieftain to get another before you can go on to Lunar Isle.
Can you take me back to Rellekka please?
Hey, if you want to go back to loserville with all the losers, who am I to stop you?
Nothing thanks! I just saw you here and thought I'd say hello!
Hey, I knew you seemed cool when I met you !
You won't make many friends on Lunar Isle without your Seal of Passage.
That's fine, I'm just going to Pirates' Cove.
Oh, I'd better go back and get it.
Lokar, can you take me back to your ship?
Sheesh, make your mind pal, I'm not a taxi service!
Actually, I've changed my mind. Again. I don't want to go.
You are possibly the most indecisive person I have ever met...
Hello. See anything good through your telescope there?
Not really, just those creatures on the island. Don't worry, we sent some men out there to deal with them.
The captain said we might have a barbecue out there later...
You seem unhappy about that... Wouldn't a barbecue on the beach be fun?
You obviously haven't met the cook yet...
Hello.
The galley ain't open fer food yet whipper-snapper, ye'll hafta come back later if'n ye be wanting food.
Uh... something something open, something something food?
Aye, ter be sure, yer yella-bellied land-lizard!
Okay...
Hi.
So... What are you doing?
Me? I'm the navigator. My job is to ensure the ship travels where it's supposed to go once it's moving by constantly checking our
bearings against our plotted course, using charts and a sextant.
People often think that we just sail off when we feel like it, but its actually far more complicated than that!

Why, when you think of just how much sea there is out there, ANYTHING could happen if there wasn't a competent navigator on board ensuring that we reach our destination safely and in the shortest possible time!
Okay. So... What are you doing?
As I say, being a navigator is a real skill - you really have to think on your feet!
Yesiree, once we get sailing, it's all up to me to make sure we don't run into trouble or go off course!

Yep, as the rest of the crew basically stand around not doing much, I'll be the one in the cabin, comparing wind speeds, landmarks and charts with my sextant, making sure that we get to the destination on time, and on
course!
You could almost say that I'm the linchpin of the entire operation! Why, if it wasn't for me, the rest of the guys might be sailing for, oooh, hours, and be slightly off course and
never even known it!
They might even be a few hours late for their destination! Or a few miles down the road from it!
And then where would they be?
A few hours late or a few miles down the road?
Exactly!
Great. So... What are you doing?
Oh, just relaxing while I wait for the ship to cast off.
When we're sailing I'll be very busy you know! I'm probably the single most important person on board when we're sailing!
Okay, OKAY!
Hey, how you doing?
It is customary when stowing away on a vessel to not introduce yourself to the Captains First Mate, oh foolish one.
Hey! I'm not a stowaway!
That Lokar guy invited me aboard...
I see. Well, don't distract me as I'm making preparations for departure.
Try not to distract any of the crew either, Zamorak knows it's hard enough to get them to do any work around here without strangers wandering round the ship asking them inane questions.
Afternoon.
Hey, how you doing? You a stowaway?
(sigh) NO, I am NOT a stowaway...
And to be honest, I don't know why everybody seems to think I am...
Hey, I'm not here to judge you, if you're a stowaway you picked a good ship for it!
There's lots of convenient hiding places around here - I should know, whenever I'm in trouble with the Captain I find myself a good barrel to hide in, until the fuss dies down.
You know, I've always wondered...
What exactly is it that a 'cabin boy' actually does on a pirate ship anyway?
Mostly make coffee. Occasionally I have to swab the decks, but pirates aren't exactly known for cleanliness, you know?
Aye-aye cap'n!
Hmmmm? I don't recognise you as one of my men, what are you doing aboard my ship?
Stowaway! Stowaway! *Squark*
Oh, Lokar offered me a journey. He said you could take me to the island of the Moon Clan.
Oh he DID, did he? (sigh) I sometimes regret ever allowing that vagabond to join the crew.
He has a very bad work ethic, and I have to say his attitude can be very confrontational.
Lokar's a loser! *Brakawk*!
So... You won't take me to Lunar Isle?
Well now, I didn't say that.
We are returning there again soon anyway, as our last visit was most profitable.
In fact as soon as our boys are finished loading stocks we should be ready to depart!
Now, as captain of this ship I feel I must play host, even if you aren't exactly a welcome guest, so was there anything you wished to know?
So... What can you tell me about this 'Moon Clan'? It all seems very mysterious I must say...
The Moon Clan? Oh, very fine people. Very hospitable.
We had heard that they are very wary of strangers, and dislike people just showing up on their island, but when we sent a landing party aboard they all seemed more than happy to see us.
Well, they even threw a big festival in our honour!
Anyway, they had a large supply of items that we felt we could use on the high seas, so we made a few trades with them, and were on our way.
What kinds of items?
Well, I'm not sure how much you've heard about them, but they are magical experts.
They sold us many rune-stones, as well as a few good luck charms and talismans and such to help us on our voyage.

Yes, they might have been a little secretive about that strange temple, and the old lodge of theirs in town, and I must say they certainly have the strangest house I have ever seen in my life in their little village, but it was
a pleasant trip all round, and I look forward to trading there again in the future.
After all, it's not everywhere that a pirate captain and his crew can rest ashore without having to worry about the authorities catching them, is it?
Fight the law! *Squawk*
No, I guess it isn't.
Was there anything else you wished to ask me about while I'm not busy?
What were you doing at Lunar Isle anyway? I always thought pirates would be... You know. Out pirating.
Well, obviously the actual pirating is a big part of our agenda, but we like to think of ourselves as non- regulated merchants.
What good is plunder if you have nothing to spend it on, hmmmm?
Likewise, I am a forward thinking captain, and endeavour to invest much of my plunder back into the ship and its crew, so that we can be a better and more efficient force for theft upon the seas.
So you went to Lunar Isle for supplies?
Well, obviously not initially. Obviously, our first thought was to show up, rob them blind, then take off again with the plunder spilling from our decks.
So what made you change your mind?
Well, firstly there were the monsters.
M-monsters?
Oh yes, hundreds of the things. The island's swarming with them you know.

Dirty smelly beasts, as big as a wolf! Yes, you'd certainly better be either handy with a blade or quick on your toes if you wanted to spend much time outside of their village with those things around
everywhere.
*Squawk* Run fer yer lives lads, it's a monster! *Squawk*
So you didn't attack the Moon Clan because you were worried you would yourself be attacked by these monsters trying to make your escape?
Oh yes, absolutely. That and the next reason.
The next reason?
Yes, the next reason being that the Moon Clan are quite stupendously powerful magicians.
You'll notice it as soon as you look at them, really quite, quite powerful indeed.
As soon as we saw them we lost any thoughts about trying to attack or steal from them.
Which as it turned out was lucky for us.
Bunch of blooming loonies! *Brakawk*
It was?
Oh yes. They can read minds, you see. If we'd shown up there thinking about robbing them they would have just killed us all on the spot.
I did mention that they are extraordinarily powerful magicians, didn't I?
Yes, yes you did.
Ah, I'm glad I did. Because they really, really are. And mind-readers.
Yes, all in all I'm glad we didn't try any funny business in the end after all.
Plus there's that other good reason.
That reason being?
Well, when you are a crew of successful pirates, it becomes more and more difficult to ever moor somewhere and spend your loot.
People are far too quick to call the guards on a troublemaker nowadays.
So finding a village where people are more than happy to trade with you regardless of who you may have just stolen from and killed.
I like that non-judgemental attitude of theirs!
Okay then...
Anything else you wanted to know before we set sail?
I was hoping you could tell me a little bit about your ship. I must say, it's really very impressive.
Ah, a connoisseur! Yes, she's named the Lady Zay, and may I say, is one of the finest ships to ever sail the seas!
It was a steal from the Karamjan shipyards.
And when I say it was a steal, I mean to say that myself and some of the lads broke in and stole it one night.
I don't know who they were building these warships for, but whoever it was seemed to be a little on the short side.

We had to do a little remodelling of the doors and rooms so that we didn't have to crouch around everywhere, but I've finally got her just how I want her, and we have enough cannons down below decks to
bombard a small town I'd wager!
*Brawwwwwwk* I want guns, lots of guns! I want guns, lots of guns!
I used to own my own ship you know...
It was called the Lady Lumbridge if I remember correctly...
I wonder whatever happened to it...
Interesting. You never struck me as being Captain material, but I guess there's a ship out there for everyone...
The Lady Zay is certainly a big step up from my last ship anyway.
Your last ship? Why, what was wrong with it?
Well, it just wasn't sturdy enough!
I was on a perfectly routine raiding expedition to the east of here, when we ran into a squall, that pushed us towards the rocky shore.
A few select men and myself managed to escape with our lives intact on a small row boat, but the rest of my crew were washed ashore as the ship was wrecked on those jagged rocks.
Ah yes, it was a tragedy...
To lose such a fine ship in such an insulting manner...
And of course the rest of your crew...
Who? Oh. Yes. The crew. Yes, it was a tragedy.
I'd paid them in advance you know, I'll never see that money again!
Um... no, I actually meant it was a shame that so many of your crew must have died in the shipwreck.
Was it? Well, if you say so.
Actually, the last I had heard quite a few of them had survived, and had set up a little hideaway next to the remains of the shipwreck.
If you're particularly worried about them, perhaps you might like to go and pay them a visit someday, and make sure to bring a lot of easily transferable wealth with you.
They love people visiting with easily transferable wealth.
Now, was there something you wished to talk to me about? Time is pressing on, and we really need to set sail soon if we want to make the most of the winds.
*Squawk* Move it or lose it, move it or lose it.
Well, I would be more than happy to take you, unfortunately the Moon Clan are, frankly, very scary people, and I believe they would not take kindly to us bringing a Fremennik there.
They are at war with them after all.
But I thought Lokar had already been there?
Yes. Yes he has. I'm talking about you.
Oh. Oh yeah, I'm a Fremennik aren't I?
Yes, yes you are.
I probably should have kept that Seal Of Passage Brundt the Chieftain gave me with me, shouldn't I?
Yes, yes you should have. Honestly, you're going to need it with you.
I'm afraid I can't let you travel with us without it.
*Brakawk* Don't drop quest items half way through a quest! *Squawk*
Okay, I'll go and get it again then.
You do that.
Can we sail to Lunar Isle now? I must say, it all sounds very intriguing over there...
As long as you keep your Seal Of Passage with you at all times while you are on the island you should be okay, even if you are a Fremennik.
I'm not kidding, they are a very dangerous people, and it would NOT be wise for you to travel there without your Seal Of Passage marking you as a diplomat.
Okay, keep my Seal with me at all times, check. Can we go now?
Ah, yes indeed! The winds seem good, so let's make a move!
She's blowing a storm, cap'n! *Brarrrrrk*
Well... THAT was deuced strange!
Um... Way to sail a boat?
*Squawk* Way to sail a boat! Way to sail a boat! *Brarrrk*
This... This is VERY strange!
No, actually, I don't really want to know anything that you can tell me.
In fact, I don't even know why I began talking to you in the first place!
Hmmmm. You could perhaps be more grateful to someone offering you free transport, but then I suppose you are a friend of Lokar's, and a Fremennik, so I suppose the
rudeness is natural.
Make sure you are ready for departure, I will be issuing orders to set sail shortly.
In all my years as a pirate, I have never seen such sailing!
What do you think caused it?
If I was a less superstitious person, I would suggest an evil magic of some kind.
Iiiinteresting...
Pretty crazy sailing you guys got here!
Weird, the ships never done that before...
Do you know what's wrong with the ship? I've never seen a ship sail in a big circle like that before...
I can't say for sure, but it must be either the Captain or the Navigator to blame.
They're the only ones who control the actual sailing of the ship.
I see... Thank you, that's very helpful.
Wow. Pretty rubbish sailing just then, huh?
I have literally never seen anything like it! The ship seemed to... I don't know, suddenly swing round as we approached shore!
then somehow we were right back where we started! This is all very peculiar if you ask me, I have never seen anything like it in all of my years on the high seas.
What do you think might be happening?
Well, my first thought would be that we have jinx aboard.
A jinx?
Yes, a jinx. Someone who has recently come aboard and seems to be bringing us bad luck. If it is a jinx, the only answer would be to throw them
overboard as shark food.
You just recently came aboard the ship yourself didn't you? Because I don't recall us having any trouble before you showed up.
Uh... yes... But... I'm pretty sure I didn't do anything. I hope.
Well, you had better hope it isn't your fault. If there's one thing I hate more than a stowaway, it's a jinx.
Hey.
Woah! Did you see that crazy trip?
Yeah, what do you think happened?
I dunno, but I'm keeping out of it. I don't want anyone blaming me for it!
Fair enough.
How... bizarre.
What is?
You didn't see what the ship just did?
Yes... But I'm not a sailor. Is that abnormal then?
Yes, yes it is. VERY abnormal.
Okay then.
What do you want, spoken to the captain yet?
Not yet, but I will.
Well do it.
I am, watch, here I go.
Oh, I'm sooooo scared now.
Yeah, you better be.
But you're still here.
Yeah but not for long.
Well you better go then.
Fine, I'm gone.
Who's driving this thing anyway?
It's called sailing, but I don't know what's happening.
Is someone gonna fix it then?
I hope so. I wanted to pick up some new clothes on Lunar Isle next time we went back.
What's happening with the ship???
I was hoping you could tell me...
Sorry, no.
Pretty crazy sailing we did just then, huh?
Did we? Ah, sorry ter say but I missed the whole thing, I've bin a mite busy down here in the ole galley.
We seemed to be getting somewhere, but we're right back where we started!
Aye, I've felt like that me whole life ter be honest...
...Okay. I'll just leave you to... Whatever it is that you do.
Aye, that'll be fer the best whipper-snapper, if'n ye be wanting any food cooked at all.
What happened to the ship?
I have no idea! It doesn't normally do that!
Weird.
Yup.
So the Captain's a very bad sailor I take it?
No... Usually he's one of the best around, I don't know why we didn't reach our destination like we were supposed to, and it CERTAINLY wasn't anything to do with me
or anything I have done!
Alright, calm down I wasn't accusing you of anything!
Good, because it has NOTHING to do with me!
IT'S NOT MY FAULT!
I think you should lay off the coffee for a bit, youngster...
So you reckon it's the navigator or the Captain's fault?
Yeah, stands to reason, dunnit?
Was the ship supposed to go in a big loop like that?
Pretty sure it wasn't, no...
Any idea what caused it?
Absolutely none at all...
Did you just see that?
See what?
The ship sailing. Or not sailing. Or sailing in a big circle and coming back here.
I don't know, I'm not a sailor! But whatever it was, it was very odd!
Can't say that I did, no. Sorry, I was keeping an eye out.
An eye out? For what?
Um... Sorry, I can't really say, but I'll know it when I see it!
Sorry, don't have time to chat! Something's up with the ship, I'm trying to find out what!
I... I don't understand... This is all very strange...
That was possibly the most pointless journey I have ever taken in my life.
The course was plotted, we had a fair tailwind the whole journey...
BUT WE HAVEN'T BUDGED AN INCH!
I just don't understand it... Maybe you should speak with Jack.
Who?
Our navigator. He's at the rear of the ship, one floor below deck. He's an old sea-dog with a brown pirate's hat.
Below deck, below deck!
Can we try again?
Yes, you're right, perhaps it was just a freak wind. Off we go!
Hey, are you the navigator?
That I am. Why?
Think you can navigate us a course on this ship that isn't a BIG STUPID CIRCLE?
I'm SURE I don't know what you mean!
C'mon now... If you're the navigator, then it stands to reason it's your fault we didn't sail anywhere!

Now listen here bucko, my course was true, like all of my others, and if you have a problem with how I do my job, then you'd better go and speak to the Captain about it, because I don't appreciate a stowaway
wandering in here and criticising me!
Well maybe I will go and talk to the Captain about you.
You'd better do that then.
Fine, I will.
Hello again.
Hey there captain.
What are you wanting now?
Perhaps the navigator made a mistake when he plotted the course?
Hmmm, you think so? Perhaps I'd better ask him about that...
But... His course looked true.. I just don't understand...
I'll go ask him what happened for you, Captain.
You will? Well, thank you!
You're very helpful for a stowaway! He's one floor below deck. To the rear of the ship.
I'M NOT A STOWAWAY! GAH!
So what did the navigator have to say for himself?
Does he have any explanation for why we keep sailing in a big circle every time we try to get to Lunar Isle?
I, uh, kind of didn't bother to go and talk to him yet...
I see...
*Squaaaawk* Lazy stowaway!
Maybe we were just unlucky that last time?
Oh, you want me to try and set sail again?
It can't hurt, right?
I suppose so. Off we go!
This crazy sailing... Think it could be the navigator's fault?
Well, I guess it could be... Seems a little strange for him to do that though.
Yeah, I guess.
The captain seems to think that the navigator is repsonsible for the problems with the ship...
He's an arrogant fool, but he gets the job done.
I'd have to say the Captains wrong about that.
Hmmm. Okay, thanks.
That sailing was horrible. I blame the navigator.
You know, speaking ill of someone behind their back isn't cool.
Yeah, you're right, sorry.
So... The rumour is that it's all the navigator's fault that the ship keeps going around in a big circle.
Is it now? That sounds like exactly the kind of thing that a stowaway and a jinx might say to throw suspicion off of himself.
You think this is my fault?
Ah, so you finally admit you are a stowaway and a jinx!
What? NO! Look, I'm pretty sure it's nothing to do with me...
Well, for your sake I hope you're right. Killing people is such a chore.
I'll go and speak to the navigator immediately.
Hello there. So... That navigator.
Rumours say that it's his fault the ships going round in circles now.
Really? Seems strange to me, I made a point of watching our course last time we sailed, and we didn't deviate at all, but somehow ended up back here.
Well, the Captain thinks it must be his fault!
No... I'm not so sure about that...
Well, I spoke to both the Captain and the Navigator, and it seems to me it must be the navigator's fault that we're sailing in circles.
Seems a logical conclusion to me too.
Glad you think so!
I heard a rumour that the ship isn't going anywhere because of the navigator...
I don't deal with gossips.
So what do you think? We keep going round in circles because the navigator is useless?
Yeah, the navigator, absolutely, sounds about right, yup.
Nope, it has certainly nothing to do with me or anything that I have done to the ship, I swear on my dead mothers life!
Um... okay then.
I bet it's the navigator's fault.
What is?
The weirdness with the ship.
Hmm. Could be I suppose.
I blame the navigator for the ships weirdness.
His fault, eh? Well, I never liked him much anyway.
Yeah, me neither.
Hey, think the problems with the ship is the navigator's fault?
Yup, could be. Could well be.
Hello there. What can you tell me about the navigator of this ship?
Sorry, I've never spoken to the man.
How can you never have spoken to him? There's only like 10 people aboard the entire ship!
Dunno. Sorry.
Do you know of any reason why the navigator would be deliberately sabotaging our journey?
No, and I can't believe he would.
So. Absolutely rubbish sailing. It's the navigator's fault, right? You're with me on that, yeah?
Aye, if'n yer say it's true then it must be!
...and is the greatest pirate who ever lived?
yer say? Aye, well I guess that they must be if'n that's what ye're telling me there.
You know what? I like you.
Although admittedly I haven't tried any of your food...
So... Call yourself a navigator huh? Way to plot a course that's a big circle!
Frankly sirrah your rudeness is quite appalling!
My calculations and plotted course were expertly calculated, and there can be only one reason why the ship has failed to arrive at its expected destination.
Oh really? What's that then? Wrong kind of waves? Your steering wheel got stuck?
I do not have to take this kind of abuse from a common stowaway!
I'll have you know that I am a personal friend of the Captain, and he himself invited me aboard for a small cruise around Lunar Isle along with a variety of local delicacies and beverages!
Really? You don't seem like the type he would make friends with.
Oh, absolutely. Me and him go way back. Waaaaaaay back.
We're like... apples and custard. Everybody says so.
Yup, me and Captain Renney, we're a team.
You mean Captain Bentley?
Right. Bentley. That's what I said.
No you didn't. You called him Captain Renney.
Oh, yeah, it's like a nickname. Only his friends are allowed to call him that.
Yet I have known him for over 20 years and he has never asked to be referred to as anything except Captain Bentley.
Wow, he must hate you.
And indeed, he has never mentioned any stowaway looking vagabonds as friends.
Well, that's all besides the point. It's all your fault and I'm going to make sure the Captain fizzles your gizzard, or whatever it is you piratey types do to each other.
But it wasn't my fault!
Look, see for yourself! All co-ordinates for the journey are carefully plotted to all visible waypoints and landmasses!
There can only be one POSSIBLE explanation why the ship hasn't reached its destination, as I mentioned before!
Oh really? And what would that be then?
And your explanation had better be good, or Captain Renney is going to shiver your timbers for good!
Right. Whatever. Carry on.
Magic. It must be magic. Somebody must have jinxed our ship, but I have no idea who would have done that or why.

Although your highly suspicious behaviour towards me, and mysterious sudden appearance on board at the *exact time* that this jinx appears to have been brought upon us would seem to make you the obvious candidate.
And we all know what we do to someone who is a jinx.
Uh... We do?
Oh, I'm sure your good friend Captain Bentley has told you all about the last jinx we had on board.
Oh, absolutely he did, yes. I just uh, have these lapses in memory occasionally.
Oh, it was horrible. I never knew the human body could contain so many mackerel.
And then that thing they did with the tinderbox and the cheese... I still wake up with nightmares about that sometimes...
Er... Right. I'd better go find that jinx then before someone else accuses me of this being my fault.
SO! I've found you, YOU JINX!
What? I'm not a jinx, we've already had this discussion!
Sorry. I thought you might be, and that I could trick it out of you by shouting it at you as an accusation.
That approach works, does it?
Well, not yet, no. But there's always a first time for everything.
I think a more subtle approach might yield you better results.
(sigh) I suppose so... It just won't be as much fun...
You don't know anything about a jinx onboard do you?
Nope, sorry.
Okay, thanks.
I heard a rumour there's a jinx aboard...
Really? I hope not, they're evil things.
Hi. Know anything about jinxes?
Absolutely nothing. Sorry.
Don't worry about it.
Hi, I'm looking for a jinx...
Why would you be after one of those evil things?
Well, I think there might be one onboard.
Gosh, I hope not!
Do you know anything about jinxes?
Only that they're extremely bad things to have aboard a ship.
Yup, I'd already figured that much out.
Hello there. I have reason to believe that someone or something has somehow placed a jinx upon this ship, preventing it from sailing as it is supposed to.
Know anything about that?
A jinx yer say? Wassat, some kinda fancy foreign vegetable?
Um... No, no I don't think this ship has been cursed by a fancy foreign vegetable...
All vegetables are evil if you ask me!
I don't think I did ask you...
That's right then, we'll hear no more about evil foreign vegetables.
Or evil domestic vegetables.
Or vegetables at all! Death ter vegetables!
Okay then... 'bye.
Hey hey hey! Apparently there's a jinx on board. Or the navigator is rubbish.
One of the two, I'm not sure which.
Yes, and I believe I'm looking right at him. Would this jinx also be a stowaway?
Look, this calling me a stowaway and a jinx isn't funny!
I quite agree. Perhaps you should leave?
I'm going to find who or what this jinx is, if only so I can prove to you that it's not me!
Hmmm. Well, you had best do that then, and stop disturbing me.
You had better get some evidence quickly as well, I would so hate to have to kill you. Killing someone really tends to ruin my day.
I have it on good authority that there's a jinx on board the ship stopping it sailing anywhere.
A jinx, you say? My my my, it's been a long time since I've heard of one of those...
Do you know anything about it.
I'm afraid not, but I hope you find it. They're evil things, especially on a boat.
Hello there... Mr. Boy?
Just call me 'boy'. Everybody else does.
Don't you have a real name?
Not that I can remember, no.
Oh. Right then.
Anyway, I believe that there may be a jinx aboard this ship, and that is what is preventing us from sailing to Lunar Isle.
A jinx? I don't know ANYTHING about that!
IT'S NOT MY FAULT OKAY?
I don't think I was actually accusing you of anything there...um, boy.
You weren't? Oh. IT WAS STILL NOTHING TO DO WITH ME!
You're very defensive, aren't you?
Sorry. It's my job, you know?
I'm always getting the blame for things that go wrong aboard.
Well, I guess you don't know anything useful.
The captain thinks there might be a jinx aboard. Any help?
Well, that makes sense, but sorry I don't know anything about that.
I have reason to believe that there is a jinx aboard this ship.
IT MIGHT EVEN BE YOU!
Do I look like a jinx to you?
Erm... I don't know. I don't know what a jinx looks like.
It might be an idea for you to find out before accusing people.
Now, I'm not much of a seafaring guy, but as I understand it this ship has somehow gotten a jinx, which is messing up the sailing to Lunar Isle!
Really? Oh, that's terrible news.
I hope someone's doing something about it.
Er, yeah, I am.
Good luck with that then.
Seems like the problems with the ship are all down to a jinx.
Aw no... I hate those things...
Oh captain, my captain.
So you've spoken to my navigator again, yes? What does he have to say for himself?
Oh yes. He tried to hide his incompetence by blaming the ships' problems on a jinx of some sort.
A JINX you say???
Aye, I have to admit that does sound like a logical explanation...
No, I'm still pretty sure it's just the navigator being really rubbish at his job...
No, no, a jinx, that makes all too much sense I'm afraid...
Well, the solution is obvious.
We need to find who or what has been jinxed and remove it from the ship immediately.
Right. And when you say 'we' need to find you actually mean...?
*brakawk* He means you dummy! You dummy! *Squawk*
Well, as Captain I have certain responsibilities that must be fulfilled, so I would greatly appreciate a little assistance in tracking down this jinx...
Yeah, I was afraid you were going to say that...
Okay, I'll try and track down this jinx for you.
Good lad! Let me know if you find out anything important.
(sigh) Yes, Captain.
Hello there. So, I'm wondering if you know anything about a jinx at all?
A jinx you say? Argh, those are evil things!
Quick question: What exactly is a jinx anyway?
Ah, well they take many forms.
Sometimes it will just be a person with such staggeringly bad luck that everything they do or say invariably leads them into trouble and commotion, through no fault of their own.
Everything they touch will always bring them misery, and everything they think they have achieved will always end in disaster.
Hmmm.
But then there is the other kind of jinx, the even worse kind.
It is a curse put upon someone, often attached to an object of some kind, and it is done deliberately, so that misfortune will always follow the owner of that object.
So why is it such a big deal to sailors?
Ah, well now. When you're on land, bad luck can be an annoyance, and possibly even bring you grief, but it is rarely deadly.
A jinx on land may fall over tree roots, or lose their coins down a drain, or some other irritation.
But at sea! With nothing saving you from the cold murky death of drowning except the wood below your feet?
Why, jinxes can kill not just you, but the entire crew of a ship! They are an evil thing indeed, and the only thing you can do to save yourself and your crew is to forcibly
remove the jinx from the ship as soon as possible. Dead or alive.
Or casting some kind of anti-curse magic upon the jinxed item might work, but to be honest, throwing them overboard is quicker.
Wait, so someone with magical powers can deliberately place a jinx upon someone or something?
Oh, yes. But they would have to be a very magical and very evil person to risk the lives of an entire ship over some trivial matter.
Someone highly magical like, oh, let's say for the sake of argument, the inhabitants of Lunar Isle, a.k.a the Moon Clan?
Well, I suppose so... But for them to curse our entire boat?
Somebody from the landing party must have done something highly offensive to them at the feast for them to place such an evil enchantment that risks the lives of the entire crew.
So somebody from the landing party must have gotten themselves jinxed...
Thanks a lot 'Eagle-eye', you've been extremely helpful.
So... Any ideas who might have offended the Moon Clan and caused them to place a jinx on the ship?
No, I'm afraid I have no idea. I guess it must have happened when we were all on shore leave, but I honestly don't remember much about it...
Hmmm. No ideas at all?
Anyone from the crew you think would be particularly offensive to a bunch of highly powerful magic users?
Well, we're something of a mixed bag around here as I'm sure you've noticed, but...
Sorry. Nobody springs to mind.
Hiya.
Hi. I don't suppose you have any juicy gossip about that trip to Lunar Isle do you?
Gossip? Like what?
I heard a really funny story about the First Mate, the captain's parrot and a coconut!
No... I was thinking more something about someone behaving very badly and offending the Moon Clan somehow...
Sorry, I wouldn't know anything about that.
Hi, how can I help you?
I was wondering...
What?
I feel kind of awkward asking...
Ah, just come out and say it. I'm a pirate, it's not like I get offended easily.
Actually it's about offending people. You didn't, you know, tick off any of the Moon Clan while you were there recently did you?
Gosh, I hope not. They might have been very hospitable towards us, but there was definitely something spooky about them!
And I suppose you didn't see anyone acting untoward around them?
Sorry, can't say as I did...
Okay, well thanks anyway.
Hey, no problem.
Hi. Erm, don't take this the wrong way or anything, but are you particularly offensive?
What?!?!
Does your mere presence at any occasion cause young children to start crying, old ladies to faint, that kind of thing?
I'm not sure I like your tone of voice!
Look, all I want to know is if your terrible disregard for social niceties has caused a jinx to be levelled upon this ship and all who sail in her.
ABSOLUTELY NOT!!!
Okay, thanks! All I wanted to know!
I'm looking for somebody who may have offended the Moon Clan on your recent visit to Lunar Isle...
I'm sure I know nothing about that.
Oh. I was hoping you did.
Sorry.
Yes?
I have heard some terrible, scurrilous rumours about your wanton and depraved behaviour towards the Moon Clan when on shore leave.
What? What ARE you talking about?
Oh come now, we all know what you were up to...
Your behaviour was so bad that the Moon Clan have brought a terrible curse down upon the ship, trapping it on this gods-forsaken island forever!
Hmmm. Well, I'm sure the crew have more sense than to listen to the insane babble of a stowaway, especially not one whose rantings are designed to cover his own jinxed
life.
So you deny it then?
Deny what? You come in here, spouting some random bilge at me, with a flurry of accusations, and expect anyone to take you seriously?
Oh.. erm... Well done. You've passed the test.
Test?
Yeah... the, uh, loyalty test. The Captain wanted to make sure his crew were all well behaved on their shore leave, so I came up with this little test to make sure you were.
And congratulations! You passed!
I see.
A stowaway, a jinx, AND a liar.
I must say I am extremely glad you are only here temporarily, I would hate for any of my crew to have any sort of dealing with you.
Please make sure you close the door on your way out.
Erm, 'bye then.
Hello there.
Hi. Now... about this jinx...
Yes?
I have reason to believe that it may have been caused by somebody who has offended the Moon Clan somehow while on that recent visit of yours to Lunar Isle.
Really?
Yup. I'm afraid so.
That doesn't sound like anyone on board...
We may be pirates, but we're all surprisingly well- mannered!
So you don't know anything about it?
No, sorry.
Well, thanks anyway.
Hey. What's up?
Well, it's like this: Apparently one of the crew was up to something on Lunar Isle that caused the Moon Clan to be offended, which has led to this jinx being placed on someone or
something aboard the ship.
That's the closest I can figure it anyway, I have to admit this is all very confusing...
I SWEAR I DIDN'T MEAN TO!
...What?
...Nothing. I didn't do anything. At all.
And nobody can prove that I did, even if I had, which I didn't so they can't. So there.
Wait, are you telling me you might have had something to do with this?
No, I'm telling you the EXACT OPPOSITE!
It wasn't me! I SWEAR!
Are you sure? Because a minute ago it really sounded to me as though you-
NO! NOT ME! NUH-UH! NO WAY!
Okay, okay, I believe you, I believe you. There's no need to shout at me.
Sorry, I just didn't want you getting the wrong impression and telling the Captain anything, is all.
Fair enough, I can understand that. Well, see you around.
IT WASN'T -
Oh, I mean, goodbye stowaway.
AH-HA! I KNOW it was YOU!
Oh, what is it now?
Well, it seems that someone must have offended the Moon Clan, so that they put a jinx on the ship!
And from what I've seen you're the obvious culprit!
No, I don't think so.
This seems once again an effort on your behalf to throw the trail away from your own jinxed self bringing us misfortune.
So... You didn't offend any Moon Clan while you were on their island?
Are you REALLY sure?
I am the very model of self-restraint. As you should have realised by now, as I haven't yet given the order to have you put to death. Yet.
Hum. Are you sure?
Yes.
REALLY sure?
Yes. I suggest you check elsewhere.
Fine. But I've got my eye on you Mr Navigator!
Yes, and I certainly have my eye on you.
You know that visit to Lunar Isle you lot have just made...?
Oh yeah! It was great! They're kind of spooky, but hey, it was a great do they laid on for us!
You didn't see anyone, you know, acting inappropriately or anything did you?
How do you mean?
Um... Anyone doing anything that would offend them?
Nope, can't say as I did...
Hmmm. Okay then.
Yes?
On Lunar Isle...
You didn't... You know. Do anything offensive towards the Moon Clan did you?
Nope.
Hmmm. Okay, it was worth asking anyway.
'Bye then.
Seeya.
I've heard you were a little bit merry on the old Lunar Isle expedition...
Possibly so merry that you did something to offend the Moon Clan and unleash a horrible curse upon us all...
Heavens, no! Just because I'm a pirate doesn't mean I don't treat all cultures no matter how different with the utmost respect!
So it wasn't you?
Nope. Sorry.
Quick question: Do you know anyone who offended the Moon Clan on your recent visit?
Quick answer: No.
Okay, thanks!
Dude! Duuuuuuude! Dude!
I'm sorry, do I know you?
Dude! How about them Moon Clan, huh?
Wow, we offended them so hard on that shore leave, huh?
You, uh, didn't do anything to offend the Moon Clan on shore leave, did you?
No.
And I look like an idiot now, don't I?
You do, yes. Very much so.
It would probably be best if I just left now, instead of carrying on talking, wouldn't it?
It would, yes.
I'll go and do that then...
Hello there!
Sorry, the galley's closed fer restockings! Yer'll hafta come back later if'n ye be wanting food!
Actually, I'm not after food, I'm after information...
Wussat? Some kind of alkyhol? If'n it ain't grog, I don't be stocking it!
...Can I just ask you a few questions?
Aye, that yer may, long'n as yer don't mind me carrying on with me restockings while we talk.
No, that's fine. I appreciate your time.
So... I have reason to believe that a jinx has befallen the ship due to someone offending the Moon Clan somehow... I was wondering if you knew anything about that.
The Moon Clan yer say? Ah, well I dinna know much about them folks, when everyone else went to that there big old feast I stayed aboard the ship...
I gots ter be honest, I never trust any food I ain't prepared meself!
Wait... So the whole crew except yourself were at a big feast on Lunar Isle?
Was there drink involved at this feast?
Aye, ter be sure!
So a bunch of drunken pirates feasting on Lunar Isle.
I think I have my suspect for when the Moon Clan were offended.
Thanks for the help there, Beefy!
Hey there Beefy!
Ah, it be you agin, what can i do yer for?
About this big feast that all the pirates went to on Lunar Isle...
All the pirates cept'n me yer mean?
Yes, this big feast that everybody went to except for you.
What did yer want ter know abaht it?
Oh, just what information you could tell me about it. Who was there, what food was served, what entertainment was laid on if any, where it was held.
You know, the little details. I'm hoping I can catch someone out in a lie.
Yer wants me ter be telling yers all about a feast I wasnae even at?
Er... yes. If you could.
I thinks yer need to be laying off of the old alkyhol, mate.
Hey you know that big feast they held for us on Lunar Isle?
Us? What 'us'?
Erm, you. And the rest of the crew.
Yes, I remember it well. It was a surprisingly restrained evening on all of our parts.
So no crazy offensive behaviours from anyone.
No, not at all. Everybody was surprisingly well behaved.
I see... And the whole crew was there the whole time?
You didn't see anyone sneaking off mid-feast or anything?
No, sorry, I don't believe I did.
That big feast on Lunar Isle... You were there right? The whole evening?
Yup.
Didn't see anyone being rude to the Moon Clan? Weren't being rude yourself?
Nope.
Didn't see anyone sneak away in the middle of the feast or anything?
Okay then, that's all I wanted to know.
Hey there.
Hi.
I was wondering if I could ask you a few questions about the big feast you went to on Lunar Isle?
Oh man, that feast totally RAWKED!
So you got a little bit merry at it?
Oh man, like you WOULDN'T BELIEVE!
You didn't get... TOO overboard with your fun did you?
No way man, I know when enough's enough.
You didn't see anyone else going... a little bit too far with their fun either?
No, I have to say everybody was surprisingly well behaved considering it was our first shore leave in quite a few months!
Okay, thanks for your help.
You again? You still looking for the jinx then?
Yeah, I just have a few quick questions for you...
Ask away. I have nothing to hide.
Well, I just wanted to ask you about that big feast on Lunar Isle you went to...
Ask away.
Did you see anyone slip away during it? Or see anyone acting extremely badly? Or maybe you saw someone being rude to the Moon Clan somehow?
I'm sorry, I didn't see much beyond the food on my plate and the grog in my tankard.
Okay, I'll have to continue checking around.
Well, good luck with that. I'm very uneasy knowing that there's a jinx on board.
Hey, how you doing?
Very well thanks, I just have a few questions I'd like to ask you about that big feast at Lunar Isle...
Ah yes, those were the days!
Good, was it?
Oh, like you wouldn't believe... The food... The wine... The women... The songs...
It was everything any honest pirate could ever hope for!
And you were all there?
Hmmm... I think so...
Except the Captain obviously.
And you didn't see anyone behaving particularly badly? Or being rude to any of the Moon Clan or anything?
Can't say as I did.
I have some questions for you about that big feast you all went to on Lunar Isle.
Oh no, not you again!
AH-HA! IS that an admission of guilt?
How is that an admission of guilt???
Well, you didn't deny anything.
What's to deny??? You haven't asked me anything!
A minor technicality.
(sigh) Please... Please just ask me your questions then leave me alone...
Well okay then. So tell me Mr Navigator, where were you exactly at this feast on Lunar Isle?
Er... at the feast?
Oh, really?
Yeees....
So you claim to have been at this feast the whole time that you were at this feast?
Um... yes, how could I not have been at the feast the whole time that I was at the feast?
I'm asking the questions here!
So you were at the feast. So you say.

But I put it to you Mr Navigator that once you had arrived at the feast, when it grew quieter and nobody noticed, you left and decided to steal something from the Moon Clan, and be very rude to some other
members of the Moon Clan on the way.
And then you... I don't know. Killed their puppies or something.

Then after you had done all that, you returned to the feast, before anyone noticed that you had left, and then made sure your alibi was complete, and that nobody would discover your rude, thieving, puppy murdering
ways.
Look, I've had just about enough of you!
AH-HA! I notice you don't deny it!
clear that if anybody is a jinx on this ship it is you!
ARE TOO!
Look, this is getting us nowhere, I promise you if you confess I will make the Captain go easy on you!
Confess to WHAT exactly??? I have done nothing wrong!
I went to a feast on Lunar Isle, I stayed with the rest of the crew the whole night, I didn't see anyone offending them, and I didn't do anything to offend them myself!
Thanks, that's all I wanted to know. See you around.
Ahoy there! I have a few questions for you.
Hmmmm?
It's about that feast that you all went to on Lunar Isle...
What of it?
You had a good time at it, right?
Well of course. Even the first officer has to have a little relaxation every so often.
But you didn't get drunk and start a fight with anyone, or insult your hosts the Moon Clan?
Well, of course not. Even in my spare time I have to show a little decorum.
Set an example to the men and all that.
So you definitely didn't insult any of the Moon Clan at the feast?
Absolutely not.
Hmmm, ok. You didn't see anyone else getting too rowdy did you?
No I didn't, and let me assure you that if I HAD they would have been most severely reprimanded by myself if not by the Captain.
I won't tolerate that kind of behaviour amongst my crew, even if they are in their free time.
Captain!
Mmmmm? You have information on what has happened to my ship for me?
Not as such, but I think I am onto a promising lead.
Apparently you all went to a big feast on Lunar Isle held by the Moon Clan when last you visited?
That is correct, yes. I was most pleasantly surprised by their hospitality.

Well, I don't want to go flinging out unfounded accusations or anything, but I have a strong suspicion that somebody at that feast did something that resulted in the Moon Clan getting offended and causing this jinx
to be placed on the ship.
In fact, it might not even be the ship that's been cursed, it could just be this person, or even some item they're carrying.
Hmmm. You know, that's some good thinking. You're right, I suspect something like that did indeed happen.
Do you have any idea who this person may have been?
*Brakawk* Who's a jinx? Who's a jinx?
No, I'm afraid not. But with your permission, I will ask around the crew and see if anybody knows anything.

You obviously have my full permission, I have no desire for a jinx to be aboard my vessel, and if this has been the result of one of my crews thoughtless actions, then I will of course have to reprimand them severely.
Thank you. I thought you might say that.
So let's begin with you: Where were you at the night of the feast, and what exactly were you doing?
WHAT? You suspect ME of having been jinxed???
No, not really, but it pays to be methodical in something like this.
Ah, yes, I understand. Well now...
As captain, I was first envoy to the Moon Clan and took seat with their dignitaries and the higher ranking members of their tribe, the Oneiromancer, Baba Yaga and so forth.
I do recall we had a most intriguing conversation about the history of their people, and their manufacturing of rune-stones for trade across the world.
So the rest of your crew weren't with you?
No, they were seated at a different table towards the back of the hall. I felt that they deserved a little recreation and relaxation time without their captain hanging around.
They're a good crew and have served me well!
So you don't actually know which of the crew were present at this feast? For all you know somebody might have slipped away from the feast and, oh I don't know, stolen some
artefact of theirs, or broken into somewhere they weren't supposed to go?
Well, of course that is all possible, but I wouldn't think any of my crew would be so rude as to break the gracious hospitality we had been offered!
We're pirates after all, not barbarians!
*Squawk* Not barbarians! Not barbarians! *Squawk*
Well, thank you for your time Captain, I'll see if anybody else noticed someone slipping away during the feast, or noticed someone behaving particularly badly towards any of the Moon Clan.
Please keep me informed of your discoveries. A jinx is an evil thing, and if one of my crew has brought it upon the Lady Zay, then I want to know about it.
Hi. That big feast you went to on Lunar Isle...
Sorry, I don't remember much about it, I'd had a fair bit to drink.
Oh really? Do you think maybe while drunk you did something to offend them?
I don't see how, not with my condition.
Condition?
Yes, it's a very rare medical condition.
When I'm drunk I become completely silent and immobile, and just sit quietly by myself until I have sobered up.
Erm, this is a genuine medical condition is it?
Oh, absolutely. I'm in the medical books and everything.
Hmmm. Okay then, I guess you're off the hook.
Hi. You know that big feast you went to on Lunar Isle?
I do indeed.
You were there all night with the rest of the crew?
I was.
Didn't see anyone leave early?
Not that I recall.
Didn't do anything to offend the Moon Clan, or see anyone else doing anything like that?
Nope, can't say as I did.
Hi. I don't suppose you saw anyone acting suspiciously at that big feast on Lunar Isle did you?
No, sorry.
It was worth asking anyway, thanks.
Hi. How's the search for the jinx going?
Not very well to be honest...

I think I've worked out that whatever happened to cause the Moon Clan offence and get this ship cursed somehow must have happened at that big feast you all went to, but I'm still no wiser as to what actually
happened...
Well, if you think it will help I can tell you everything I remember about the feast...?
Actually yeah, that might help give me some clue as to what happened. Please, go ahead.
Well now, let's see...
I recall that we all headed onto the island as we were due shore leave, and the Captain had arranged a big feast with the Moon Clan so that we could kick back and relax.
I think we were all there, but we had a table to ourselves where they just brought us food and wine all evening.

I remember Beefy the cook was being a bit of a killjoy and had stayed on board the ship, and the Captain was having some fancy meal with the Moon Clan toffs, but I'm pretty sure the rest of us were all at the meal...

Anyway, spirits got a little high later on after we'd finished eating, and I remember Tommy Two-times got out his old fiddle, and we sang and danced all through the night until daybreak when we made our way back
aboard the ship, and set sail.
When you say there were high spirits... You don't think perhaps you accidentally offended the Moon Clan somehow do you?
No, not at all! A couple of charming Moon Clan members came over and danced along with us!
Well, thanks for the help, but I don't think I'm any closer to solving this whole jinx mystery...
Well, I wish you luck, because it is very unnerving to think that I'm sailing on a cursed ship!
That big feast in Lunar Isle...
Yes? What about it?
Was everyone there?
Except for the Captain, I think so, yes.
And did you see anyone misbehaving particularly badly?
No, I don't think I did.
Hi.
Hi. Did you find the jinx yet?
Funny you should ask, I have a few questions for you about that.
Oh no... Look, I'm SO SORRY, I SWEAR it wasn't my fault!
Huh?
Erm, sorry, nothing, what did you want to know?
Oh, well, it was about that feast that you all went to on Lunar Isle.
Oh, the feast, right, yeah, I was definitely there at that, absolutely.
So... Did you notice anyone not there? Or anyone acting very rudely to the Moon Clan? Anything like that?
Um, no, no, everyone was there, yup.
Nothing at all?
Nope, we had a meal and then, um, some other stuff happened...
Um... And then... Er, we all went to bed for an early night.
Really? That doesn't sound much like the big raucous feast I've been hearing about from other people...
No, it TOTALLY happened EXACTLY like that. I swear.
Hmmm. Weird. Maybe I'm barking up the wrong tree...
Yup, sounds like it, okay, well 'bye!
I have a couple of questions to ask you about the big feast on Lunar Isle you went to last time you went there.
Aaaahhhh yes.... I was quite taken with their hospitality!
Did you see anyone being rude to the Moon Clan at all?
Well, we were all in high spirits, but I certainly didn't see anything like that going on.
And I don't suppose you saw anyone slip away in the middle of the festival or anything?
Other than the First Mate, no I didn't see anyone slip away from the feast.
Okay tha- Wait, you say you saw the First Mate slip away in the middle of the feast?
That I did. I don't think he saw me see him leave, but it was definitely him.
I watched him head towards our ship, and he came back, oh, I don't know, twenty minutes later or so.
I doubt anyone else saw it, he just slipped away in the midst of the festivities.
Thank you, you've been very helpful.
No problem.
So now I think that the First Mate may have something to do with the jinx that has befallen this ship.
What? Why? Because I said I saw him slip away in the middle of the feast?
Erm.. Yes?
I said I saw him slip away, but I don't believe he had anything to do with whatever angered the Moon Clan, if that's the lead you're chasing up.
What do you think he was doing then?
I have no idea. Maybe you should ask him.
I have some good news!
You do?
After much to-ing and fro-ing, I've discovered that not everybody who was supposed to be at the feast actually was!
W-what???
Well, it seems as though SOMEBODY slipped off in the middle of the feast, thinking nobody would see them do it.
Unfortunately for them, somebody DID see them leave, and I'm pretty sure whatever they were up to caused this jinx.
I'M SO SORRY! I SWEAR I DIDN'T MEAN TO!
Oh, did you see the First Mate leave as well?
W-what?
That's not what you were talking about?
Um, no, no it really was, yup, so somebody saw the first mate leave and not, oh, say, saw me, right?
You left the feast?
Ahahahahaha no, no, not at all, definitely not, nope.
So anyway, I figure I'll have this whole jinx thing straightened out after a quick chat with the First Mate.
So it was all his fault? What a relief, uh, tragedy that has befallen us that is entirely all his fault and not mine.
The First Mate..
What about him?
I'm thinking he might be responsible for the jinx on the ship.
Why are you thinking that?
Well, you know. It's fifty percent baseless gossip and fifty percent unfounded speculation.
...I see. I don't for a second agree with you, but I see.
So tell me... What do you know about the First Mate?
Davey-boy? What do you want to know about HIM for?
Well, it turns out that he was the only member of the crew other than the Bosun and the Captain who did not attend the feast on Lunar Isle.
No, he was there, I distinctly remember him telling me to slow down on the drinks in case I made a fool of myself.
Yeah, but I have reason to believe that sometime during the meal he slipped away and did something or other.
I can only assume that he was up to no good when he slipped away, and whatever he did caused the ship to be cursed...
We're talking about the same Davey-boy here?
I think so... The First Mate, yeah.
I don't believe it of him. Honestly, I can't say I like the man, but he has integrity.
He would never knowingly do anything that might hurt this ship or her crew in any way.
Then perhaps unknowingly...?
Again, I doubt it. He is a very cautious man, often thinking ahead of what consequences might arise from any given action.
The things that make him a very boring human being are what makes him a superb first mate.
So you refuse to believe that he had anything at all to do with the jinx that's been placed somewhere on this ship?
I suggest you speak to him about this, because I cannot for one second believe he has had anything to do with it.
Thanks, you've been very helpful.
So... The First Mate. What can you tell me about him?
Not a lot. He's a bit of a slave driver.
Do you think he might have been responsible for the jinx that's been placed upon the ship?
Him? Naaaaaaaah...
He's way too straight-laced to have been up to anything dodgy.
Do you remember seeing the first mate at the feast?
Only for part of it. I was pretty drunk though. I'm not sure I remember anything but the start of the evening.
You know that big feast you went to? I have reason to believe that the First Mate snuck away in the middle of it.
I am forced to conclude he did so in order to get up to shenanigans.
Shenanigans?
Indeed!
I'm not exactly sure what you mean by shenanigans, but the First Mate is an honest, hard-working man.
HE would never do anything to harm the ship or its crew.
Really?
Really.
Hmmmm. Maybe I'd better go speak to him about it.
I think you'd better.
Captain! I think I've made a breakthrough!
Oh? Please, do tell.
Well, it seems that while the rest of the crew were at the feast, the First Mate snuck away by himself and was up to shenanigans!
Davey-boy?
Rubbish. I don't believe it. You must be mistaken.
Well, I have a witness...
I don't care. Not him. No way. I suggest you go and speak to him about this, whatever he did he would have had a very good reason for,
and would certainly never put this ship or her crew in any sort of risk.
He's just not that sort of a person.
I'll go and see what he has to say for himself then.
Oh, what now???

I just thought you might like to know, that I have reluctantly decided that the problems with the ship may possibly in some small degree perhaps actually not be entirely down to your incompetence after all.
That's your way of apologising for falsely accusing me of all that stuff earlier is it?
No, because an apology would imply that I have done something wrong, and I still think that your rubbishness at, er, navigatorness, is a contributing factor towards the ships problems.
And when I say contributing factor I mean it's still mostly your fault.
Why, you insufferable...
And let me assure you, if I find out that you were in cahoots with the First Mate to bring this jinx upon us, then I will not hesitate to bring it to the Captains attention.
Wait, you mean you're saying you think the First Mate has done this???
No. No way. You're even more off base with your crazy assumptions than ever.
Hey, you know that big feast you all went to?
Well, we weren't all there. The Captain was at the high table, and the Bosun didn't trust their food and stayed on ship.
Would it surprise you to hear that the First Mate was also not there?
It would indeed, because I saw him there with my own eyes!
I have it on very good authority that he slipped out in the middle of the feast for about twenty minutes or so.
Really? Well, I guess he could have, I wasn't watching him all night...
Any ideas what he might have been up to?
None at all I'm afraid.
Okay thanks.
Hey, that big feast you went to...
I already told you, I didn't see anyone acting out of order at it.
Well, that's kind of what I wanted to ask you about...
Well, I understand the First Mate snuck out in the middle of the feast...
Did he? I can't say as I remember...
So you didn't see him at the feast, and you didn't notice that he wasn't there?
Sorry. You know how it is at a party!
Hello to you.
So... I heard a rumour...
That maybe this ship going in a circle business is down to the First Mate...
Hmmmm? What makes you say that?
Well, it seems he slipped away unnoticed at that big feast you all went to.
Really? Well, he must have had some official business to do.
Trust me, that guy? He wouldn't do anything to harm the ship or it's crew in any way.
Honestly. I suggest you go and speak to him, I'll bet you anything he has a good explanation.
I'll go and do that then.
Hey, I heard that the First Mate wasn't at that big feast!
Really. And?
And what?
No, that's what I was asking you.
I'll ask the questions here!
Well what did you want to know?
I, um, can't remember now...
Maybe you'd better go think about it then.
You know, I'm getting the feeling that this jinx upon the ship might be the First Mate's fault.
Why would you think that?
Well, apparently he slipped away in the middle of the feast, so my guess is he was up to something when he did that.
The First Mate? No, that doesn't sound like him at all.
I dunno, my evidence against him is pretty good...
No, it definitely wouldn't be him.
Hey, you were onboard the ship the night of that big feast on Lunar Isle weren't you?
Did you happen to notice, oh, say, the First Mate come aboard while everybody else was at the feast?
Ter be honest, I don't remember much of what happened terday, let alone stuff that happened awhiles back
Er... okay then.
So... Finally we get to the truth... MISTER Davey-boy.
IF that's even your REAL name.
Hmmm?
You're finally confessing to being a stowaway and a jinx?
What? NO
No, Davey, this is about YOU!
This is about your LIES and your BAD behaviour!
Oh, what on Gielinor are you on about now?
I know your SECRET Mr first mate! I know that you are a PHONY!
I know that you were NOT where you claimed to be on the night in question!
Night in question? Phony? Secret?
What ARE you blathering about now?
Oh, come come, Davey-boy! It is too late to weasel your way out of this one!
I have absolutely no idea what on earth you are talking about.
Oh, you know... your ALIBI?!?!
Alibi?
YOU know. How you told me that you were at that feast on Lunar Isle ALL night?
Well, let me tell YOU that you are a LIAR!
I have an eyewitness that SAW you leave the feast, and go off and do who-knows-what for a good TWENTY MINUTES!
I think it is time to come clean, Davey-boy. I think we should hear the truth.
What? Well of COURSE I was at that feast all ni...
...Hmmm. You know, now that you come to mention it, you are correct, I did leave the feast.
AH-HA! I KNEW IT!
Oh, do calm down, it was nothing particularly interesting.
I merely had to inspect the rigging was secure before the ship was docked securely for the night.
It's one of those things you have to do, in case a storm blows up while we're asleep and yanks the ship off to sea unattended.
So why didn't you tell me this before?
Well, clearly it slipped my mind.
It's not one of my usual responsibilities, so obviously I didn't think much of it.
Wait, what do you mean it's not one of your usual responsibilities?
It's the cabin boys' job to ensure that the rigging and the sails have been safely secured before disembarking the ship.
Pirates Regulations #445-328.
So why didn't he?
I have no idea. I couldn't find him at the feast, so I left to secure them myself.
Wait, so he wasn't even at the feast?
Not that I could see, no. And I do recall I spent some good time looking for him.
So the cabin boy wasn't at the feast at all? WHY DIDN'T YOU TELL ME EARLIER?!?!
I suppose it slipped my mind. Surely it can't be of any importance, a runt like that?
It's only the single most important thing you've said to me since I've met you!
If you say so.
Well, I guess this explains why the Cabin Boy's been acting so suspiciously... I'd better go and have a word with him!
Hey! Where'd the Cabin Boy go? I need to speak to him!
Why... That's odd, he was here a minute ago!
Know where he might have headed?
I'm pretty sure that the Cabin Boy is responsible for the jinx on this ship.
Aye? Well yer best be speakin' ter him 'bout that then.
I'm pretty sure now that it was the Cabin Boy that has caused all this.
I wish you would make your mind up, or are you just going to go around accusing everyone?
Well if I did accuse everyone, eventually I would be right.
Your powers of investigation are impressive, for sure.
Thanks.
Captain?
The last time I checked, yes, I am.
No, I meant, 'Captain? Can I have a word with you?'
You just did didn't you?
(sigh) Let's start again...
Captain, I need to speak to you.
Speak away. How goes the search for the jinx?
Well, I think I may have found who was responsible for upsetting the Moon Clan.
Hmmm? Who would that be then?
Well, I'm pretty sure it was the Cabin Boy.
As you have already accused two of my crew unfairly, may I ask what leads you to this conclusion?
Well he seems to be the only member of the crew who was absent without a good reason to be so.
I see. And have you spoken to him about this?
It is very possible he has a valid reason to have not been present.
As I understand it Pirate Regulation number 445-328 required him to have been checking the sails.
Yes, but the First Mate was doing that instead of him.
That's very strange. So what does he have to say for himself... Have you asked him?
Erm... Not yet, no.
Then I suggest you do so. Immediately.
Really? Then you had best speak to him about it.
It was you!
Me?
Yes, you left in the middle of the feast, what did you do? You're a spy for the Moon Clan aren't you.
No!
Admit it!
But...
I'll go get the captain, a plank and a hungry shark!
Ok, OK! I confess.
Yes! 1-nil to the Player!

There's no need to brag! Yes, I left the feast. I was lured by a girl from the Moon Clan, she promised me control of the ship if I did this simple task for her. I couldn't resist. Have you any idea how hard it is being
a boy on a ship full of pirates?! I had no idea it would turn out how it has.
What did she ask you to do?

She showed me some symbols, she then asked me to draw five of them throughout the ship. Some kind of magic jinx. Please don't tell the Captain! He'll kill me! If I ever get to that island again, I'm going to see what
she has to say for herself.
I dunno. Some people! I will see what I can do.
You'll need a special kind of lantern to see them, there are five symbols in total I think. I vaguely remember what I put them on. One was up on a wall.
One was on a container. One was on a box of some sort. One was on a support. The last one is hazy, all I remember is that it was big and metal.
You best not be lying!
I'm not! Honest. Look, I have a lantern and lens here, put them together then light it with a tinderbox. Then you can use it to search the ship for the symbols.
You really can't remember where you drew those symbols?
I vaguely remember what I put them on. One was up on a wall. One was on a container. One was on a box of some sort.
One was on a support. The last one is hazy, all I remember is that it was big and metal. Use the lantern and lens together and light with a
tinderbox. Then you can use it to search the ship for the symbols.
One was on a support. The last one is hazy, all I remember is that it was big and metal.
I'm not! Honest. Look, use the lantern and lens together and light it with a tinderbox. Then you can use it to search the ship for the symbols.
Oi! I need another lens, boy.
But you don't have space.
Good point.
By all means, here you go!
Oi! I need another lantern, boy.
How's things?
What do you mean 'how's things'? Here we are going in circles waiting for you to sort out this jinx, and you ask 'how's things'?
I was just trying to be polite.
Don't bother.
Seen any symbols around here.
None at all - you thinking of making some?
Oh no, i'm trying to remove them.
Well it turns out it was the Cabin Boy. I just need to find some symbols he's written now.
I knew he was up to no good.
Do you know where I can find any magic symbols?
No sorry.
I don't suppose you've seen any magic symbols around?
None at all.
Actually, that's no surprise as you need a special lantern to see them.
Best you get a move on then. My reputation as a navigator is at stake!
Ah, you again. So what did the Cabin Boy have to say for himself?
It seems he has been drawing symbols over various surfaces in the ship. Don't be too hard on him though.
Don't worry, I was a young'un once. I remember when I used to have all my fingers and toes, and when my right eye wasn't made of glass.
Yes, we all remember those days. Sort of...
Well it turns out it was the cabin boy. I just need to find some symbols he's written now.
I knew he was up to no good.
I'm on the search for symbols. Seen any?
Nope, sorry.
I'm looking for symbols. Have you seen...
You do know both of these eyes are made of glass don't you?
Ooops. Sorry.
Arrr!
Arrrr!
Arrrrrrrrr!
Arrrrrrrrrr!
AAARRRRRRRRR!!!!!
AAAAARRRRRR!
Ok, i'm bored of that.
Yo ho yo ho! A pirates life for me!
How do ye know that sacred song of the pirates?
I thought it was pretty much common knowledge.
It is?
Yes.
Arrrrr!!!
I don't suppose you've seen any symbols around have you?
Written in chalk?
That's it!
Strange magical symbols?
Yes!
That look like they were drawn by a member of the moon clan?
Exactly!
No, sorry.
Ah-ha! I've found one!
One down, four more to go!
Two down, three more to go!
Three down, only two more to go!
Four down, only one more to go!
That's it, I've removed all the symbols, and hopefully the jinx.
What is it like being a pirate?
That's a strange question. I'ts not too bad I suppose. Sure, the pay is good, but the hours are long and we don't get many holidays.
Do you not have a union to help you?
A pirates union? No, they would stab us in the back at the first opportunity.
That's a shame.
The jinx has been removed!
What jinx?
Nevermind.
What is your favourite tipple?
Drink? Big beards Frothy Rum headbanger!
Ahhh, a true classic.
The jinx should be lifted now. You're free to navigate us to the island!
That kind of order can only come from the Captain, I'm afraid. Go speak with him.
Well lucky for you I found all the symbols.
Phew. Good work.
I have discovered all the symbols!
What, you want a medal or something.
I've removed all the symbols.
Best you get us on our way then!
I've found all the symbols.
Best you go talk to the captain then.
I think i've removed the jinx now.
Well done, we'll make a pirate out of you yet!
Arrrr!
Arrrrrrrrrr!
AAAAARRRRRR!
Can't you see i'm busy?
Well... no to be honest you seem pretty care-free at the moment.
Well don't be deceived by looks! I'm busy practicing looking fierce.
It's very important to strike fear into the enemy just by looks. It's rule 1 of being a pirate.
Whatever.
The jinx on the ship should have been removed now.
Well done!
The jinx should be gone now!
Really? Good work, landlubber!
No worries. It was all down to the cabin boy, it seems.
Pesky kid. Ah, but I remember when I was a cabin boy. Many years ago, I started off as...
Spare me the life story, can we go now?
No need to be rude.
Sorry.
Very well. It's off we go!
Here we are! Lunar Isle!
Thanks Cap'n.
Don't you miss your family, y'know, being a pirate out as sea?
You assume I have a family?
Sorry, you don't?
I do. 16 kids, 12 nephews and 18 nieces.
Wow! I pity your wife.
I wouldn't, she never cooks my dinner when I get home.
Should I remember anything when visiting this island? Can you give me any advice?
Yeah, don't scratch your nose with an axe.
What does that have to do with the island.
Well if you don't want my advice...
What are you cooking?
My speciality! What else could I be cooking?
Ok, and your speciality is...?
Boiled shark guts with a hint of rosemary and a dash of squid ink.
I think I'll stick to making my own food.
Your loss!
Don't you ever get sea-sick?
Nah. I get land sick though, i'm always glad to return to the waves.
How bizarre.
I feel a little sea-sick from this travelling.
Well there's a good remedy for that.
There is?
Yes.
What?
Swim.
Oh HA HA. Thanks for the help!
My pleasure.
I was being sarcastic.
I know. So was I.
So we've made it to the island. What are you waiting for - I thought you were going to go see that girl?
I will, I will. I'm just psyching myself up first!
That's probably for the best. You'll need to be psyched up to confront her.
What do you do for fun on this ship? You know, when you're not doing pirate stuff.
All sorts! Hide and seek, pin the patch on the pirate, walk the plank!
What a life! Wait a minute. 'Walk the plank'? Surely that's a bit dangerous?
Well of course, but where's the fun without a few deaths?
I think I'll stick to Runelink.
What does it take to become first mate on a ship?
Good question. We have a diplomatic consession at the turn of the financial year. Said pirate is chosen should the existing mate be absent without leave.
I had no idea. I always figured it was all about popularity.
It is. I'm just pulling your leg.
At last - Lunar Isle!
Woop de do!
We have arrived at the island.
Really? You don't think a pirate would know the difference of being out at sea and being at a dock?
I can't say anything right with you Pirates.
Well get the hint then!
I think it's time to go exploring around this island.
Good luck, tis a wierd place for sure!
I feel a bit sick.
Sea sick?
No, it's the smell. Can't you smell it?
I can just smell that beautiful smell of fish guts.
Oh dear...
Looks like we have arrived at the island.
Aye, let the feasting begin!
I'm off to the island now.
Fare well!
I'm looking forward to looking around the island.
Arrr, tis a bootiful place to be sure. Watch your step though. The Moon Clan don't suffer outsiders easily.
I'll be careful.
And you're wanting what now?
I'll take you as far as Pirates' Cove. You'll have to find the rest of the way back yourself.
So we're here?
Yep. You're free to explore the island. Be careful though, the Moon Clan are very powerful, it wouldn't be wise to wrong them.
Thanks, I'll keep that seal of passage close.
Can we head to Lunar Isle?
Sure matey!
So you've plucked up the courage to come and confront that girl!
That I did, that I did!
And?
She turned out to be really nice! She's joining us to become a pirate!
Really? And you're not sceptical about this? You know, after what she did last time?
She---has---no---spell---on---me.
Huh? Why are you talking like that?
Like what?
Like someone else was talking for you. Are you sure she hasn't put a spell on you again? Did she wave a watch in front of your face? You know, tell you to look deep into her eyes?
I think you've been hypnotised. I wonder what happens if I click my fingers?
*Cluck* *cluck* *bwaarrk*
Oh dear. Oh well, I'm sure you'll learn one day.
Ah! A visitor from a distant land! How can I help?
It's a very interesting house you have here. Does he have a name?
Why of course. It's Berty.
Berty? Berty the Chicken leg house?
Yes.
May I ask why?
It just has that certain ring to it, don't you think? Beeerteeee!
You're ins...
Insane? Very.
I'm good thanks, bye.
Hi
Managed to get the Dramen staff enchanted?
No, not yet. What do I have to do?

You are going to have to get hold of a Dramen staff first, which you should be able to get from Entrana. Take it to the air, fire, water and earth altars, in that order, to embue it with power to convert it into a
Lunar staff. Bring that back to me and then we can get on with the next stage.
