And don't worry, you'll be able to do anything you can with the new enchanted version of the Dramen Staff as you could with it's ordinary form! Including visiting the lost city!
OK, thanks.
I have indeed!
Well done, pass it here.
Now we can get on with the next stage - your suit! There are 8 parts to this.
Which would you like to hear about?
The helm.
This helm needs to be made from an ore you can only get from the mine on this island. You'll see some stalagmites that you can mine from.
The cape.
There should be one of these floating around somewhere. Talk to some of the people in the village and I am sure one of them will be able to help you.
The amulet.
You should go and speak with Meteora, she always seems to be wearing one on her head for some reason. She might give that to you.
The torso.
You'll find a monster called the Suqah that is indigenous to this island. You'll need one of their hides to make your torso, which you can tan only in this town.
The gloves.
You'll find a monster called the Suqah that is indigenous to this island. You'll need one of their hides to make your gloves, which you can tan only in this town
The boots.
You'll find a monster called the Suqah that is indigenous to this island. You'll need one of their hides to make your boots, which you can tan only in this town
The trousers.
You'll find a monster called the Suqah that is indigenous to this island. You'll need one of their hides to make your trousers, which you can tan only in this town
The ring.
You should probably go and speak to Selene, she will be able to help you as she always seems to have bits and pieces like that hanging around.
Hi, could you refresh my memory: what am I supposed to be doing?
Well you need to be making your Lunar clothes.
I'm on the lookout for ceremonial clothing so I can visit my dreams. I don't suppose you could help me out?
Ah, I know the ceremony very well. Maybe I can help. I do have a cape, but why would I want to give it to some random person off the streets?
Because you're a kind person and like helping people in need?
Nice try. But I am always glad to help a person in need, if they can demonstrate some insight.
I'm listening...
How about you try and guess my name!
Bob?
How rude!
Well you do seem to have a moustache growing.
Get out of my sight!
Pauline
Ah, you'd think so, but no. That is my alias. I want you to tell me my REAL name! I have one first name, and a triple barrel surname!
Oh no. Can't you give me some kind of clue?
Let's see...
OK. Change a letter from the word Dane to get my first name. The first part of my surname rhymes with wood, the third part rhymes with spade and the second rhymes with magic.
Nope. Not even close.
That's it! Well done.
Woo hoo! Not the most normal name is it?
It's not my fault my parents had an over active imagination.
Sounds like they were totally insane.
Do you want this cape or not?
Sorry, yes please.
Tina?
Ha! Nice try, but no.
Can I try guessing your name again to get the cape? And can I have the clues again?
I don't like to repeat myself, but...
Ah, a stranger to our island. What brings you here?
Well, I've actually come here on a diplomatic mission. I want to try and settle some of the disputes between the Fremenniks and your clan.
The Fremenniks? Pah! They are just too ignorant and stubborn to listen to anything we have to say - how can we possibly associate with a race that won't listen?
I think they are very eager to listen, but they feel like you are keeping secrets from them.
Secrets?
Yes, as in your magic ways. To be honest, I think it is fear of the unknown.
Well, when the day comes that a Fremennik can prove they have the patience and interest in learning our ways, then we will perhaps share our secrets.
I'm hoping I might be able to achieve that.
Good luck. It's far from simple.
Greetings sweetie. How can I help?
Can you tell me a bit about your people?
Ok. Like what?
How about the values of the Moon clan!
Let me see... We value knowledge of self because it is this that gives us our strength! It is most important!
Well... I know things about myself. I know I like hot chocolate!
I was meaning something a little deeper than that. We also like to see someone listen. You know how they say a wise man listens?
Did you hear me?
.... I'm listening.
Most wise.
I'm looking for a ring.
Well there are a great many rings darling, try to be more specific.
It's to go with the ceremonial clothes I need for visiting the dream land.
Ah, I see. I'm afraid to say I don't have one of those. But... I do know that my grandfather had such a ring, but he passed away a long time ago.
There is a chance he buried it though.
Buried it? Why would he do a thing like that?
He was an archaeologist. Well, more of a treasure hunter. When I was little he always used to bury items around the island and give me clues and maps to find them. If you're lucky you
might find one of those rings.
It's worth a shot.
I remember those days fondly, hours of digging around, dodging boulders, pits of snakes...
About that ring...
Ah, yes.
The clue I have written down here says: From water's source you should follow, crossing the western-most bridge and travelling further south- westerly to a bloom of blue.
Thanks... I hope.
I'm not going to talk to someone that calls me 'sweetie'!
No need to be rude dear!
Welcome to the clothes store. How might I help you?
You know the ceremonial clothes?
I certainly do! A real tricky set of garments to make.
Well that's unfortunate, because I was going to ask you how I might go about getting some.
All I can really help you out with is the tanning of the hides.
Sorry?
The ceremonial clothes are made from the hides of the Suqah monsters. Bring them to me and I will tan them for you. You can then craft them into the top, trousers, gloves and boots.
Ok.

It's an interesting creature the Suqah. You see, they have been indigenous to this island since we arrived. They seem to thrive of eating the minerals that exist in the mines below the town. We try our best to live in
harmony with them, because they provide us with a great many materials when they die, and in turn we have given them magic to help protect themselves.
Interesting.
Got any Suqah hides you want me to tan?
No, I don't have any on me. Where can I get them from?
Just kill some of the Suqah monsters dotted around the outskirts of this island.
Ah! Thanks!
Yes please!
At 100 gold pieces per hide, that'll cost you... gp.
That seems like a fair deal.
Sorry, I don't seem to have enough money. I'll be right back!
A pleasure doing business with you!
No thanks.
Hi. Say, that's a nice amulet you're wearing.
Wot?
On your head.
I ain't gat no amulet on me ed.
You have, I can see it.
Oh ah, is a replacmant for me lucky tiara, yeah?
Your lucky tiara? What happened to it?
Ah, is bad, yeah? One o doews Suqah did nick it. Wish I ad it back, yeah.
I see wot I cen do, yeah? I mean, I'll see what I can do.
Gud.
Yo yo yo! You got me tiara yet?
Not yet! Where did you say I can get it from?
One o doews Suqah did nick it. Hunt em down. Like urry it up yeah?
I have indeed, want to trade?
Sure, yeah, gimmie it yo.
I've made the Lunar Helm, but I've got it stored somewhere.
Well that's no good to me, best you go and get it.
I've got the Lunar helm!
Well done, I'll take that for safe keeping.
I've made the Lunar Torso, but I've got it stored somewhere.
I've got the Lunar torso!
I've made the Lunar Trousers, but I've got them stored somewhere.
I've got the Lunar trousers!
I've made the Lunar Gloves, but I've got them stored somewhere.
I've got the Lunar gloves!
I've made the Lunar Boots, but I've got them stored somewhere.
I've got the Lunar boots!
I've made the Lunar Cape, but I've got it stored somewhere.
I've got the Lunar cape!
I've made the Lunar Amulet, but I've got it stored somewhere.
I've got the Lunar amulet!
I've made the Lunar Ring, but I've got it stored somewhere.
I've got the Lunar ring!
Why would you want to know that? You've already given me the Lunar helm to look after.
Why would you want to know that? you've already given me the Lunar cape to look after.
Why would you want to know that? you've already given me the Lunar amulet to look after.
Why would you want to know that? you've already given me the Lunar torso to look after.
Why would you want to know that? you've already given me the Lunar gloves to look after.
Why would you want to know that? you've already given me the Lunar boots to look after.
Why would you want to know that? you've already given me the Lunar trousers to look after.
Ah you have everything! Good work!
I can give you back all the items you need now. Ah... you don't have enough space to carry them. There are eleven items in total, perhaps you should come back when you have space?
Er, how do you know how much space I have?
You're forgetting I can read you mind. I simply looked to see what you knew you were carrying, and analysed the average amount a person can carry and extrapolated...
Ok ok! I get the picture. I'll be right back.

Now, I'm going to give you some magic kindling from the first magic tree that ever grew. I shall also give you back your ceremonial clothes which I want you to put on, take hold of the Lunar staff, pour your potion on

this kindling and burn it on the giant brazier in the centre of town. If you've done all this correctly, you'll be transported to the land of dreams. I can't help you from there on, that all depends upon your
understanding of your self. Good luck!
Thanks!
You not been to dreamland yet?
What am I supposed to do again?

Take your kindling and put on your ceremonial clothes, take hold of the Lunar staff, pour your potion on this kindling and use it on the giant brazier in the centre of town. If you've done all this correctly, you'll be
transported to the land of dreams. I can't help you from there on, that all depends upon your understanding of your self. Good luck!
I've misplaced my staff.
I knew you'd do that, and I used my magic to teleport it back to me.
Erm, that doesn't sound too realistic. Thanks!
Look, do you want it or not?
Sorry, yes. Yes please.
Actually, I'll have to come back when I have a space to carry one.
I've lost my Lunar Helm.
Unfortunately I don't have space to carry it.
I've lost my Lunar Torso.
I've lost my Lunar Trousers.
I've lost my Lunar Gloves.
I've lost my Lunar Boots.
I've lost my Lunar Cape.
I've lost my Lunar Amulet.
I've lost my Lunar Ring.
Can I have more kindling?
Sure, I don't seem to be able to get rid of them!
I misplaced my potion of waking sleep.
Good job I have a spare one then isn't it!
I already knew that. I got one especially.
Well of course, I know that already, so I got a backup for you.
Oh dear, good job I pre-empted you!
I know. Good job I knew you would drop it!
Huh? If I dreamt, I certainly don't remember anything. Wait a minute! I have to wear ALL the ceremonial gear AND be holding the staff.
Let's see what this says... It seems to be my life story...
'It was in the age of the fifth that a child was born of simple beginnings. Even though he started life with little money to his name, and nothing but a dream of adventure, began career by...'
Huh? Was it all a dream?
I've been to the dreamland!
What happened there?
Well, I didn't really manage to do anything, I left straight away.
Well that's no good.
What's going on?
Don't you know, you're in the land of your own dreams!
But you can't know you're in a dream whilst dreaming, you'd wake up!
Well, this is a waking sleep.
Ok. So how do I wake up?
Just use this lectern - it's the book of your life, all that has been, all that is and blank pages for all that will be. In reading this you will return your mind to reality and the conscious world.
This all seems very deep.
What am I supposed to do now?

That is totally up to you. This is a test, it wouldn't be fair if I gave you the answers now would it? But I can tell you that there is a selection of tasks that you can choose from. I like to call them, 'A game of chance',
'Communicating in numbers', 'Chop, chop, chop away', 'Where am I?', 'The race is on!', and 'Anything you can do...'.
This is the strangest place I have ever been.
Then you don't know your mind too well, do you!
Have you learnt anything?
Nothing so far.
Give it time.
I'm making progress in the dreamland!
Very good, but you haven't learnt anything yet?
We shall see.
Well...
As previously discussed, I learned the importance of understanding others and my surroundings. That with this knowledge I can learn to help myself.
I can still remember the lesson on the importance of knowing your own abilities and having confidence in them and yourself.
There was that lesson with the dice, about appreciating the unknown, and respecting it as opposed to working against it.
I remember learning how important it is to know where you are and where you have been - your history. This helps you to plan out where you are going and to progress.
I already know the importance of seeing that not all paths are easy to walk, but if I stick at things I can succeed. What harms us just makes us stronger.
I know that it is important to relate to others and that a lot of understanding and experiences can come from that.
Why ello young. Do yow like me troys?
Troys? Oh trees?
Ya, troys.
They're very nice, but you seem to have been chopping some down.
Well, ya. Hey, bet you canna chop dem troys.
I dunno.
Ya dunno? Wew you godda know what yow can dow. Ow can you judge wot you need ta practice or learn?
Fine. I can chop down trees.
Ok, chop logs and pile em int centar. First ta twenty wins.
So I have to chop down trees and place twenty logs in the centre, first to do so wins.
Wew ya.
Ok, let's go!
You got an axe?
Not one I can use, no.
We ow you gonna chop dem troys? I can give yow a bronze axe, but nowt more.
I'm afraid I don't have any space.
Not just yet.
Av it your way!
Wot do yow wont nar?
So you want me to chop down trees?
Ya, chop logs and pile em int centar. First ta twenty wins.
Nothing, never mind.
Stop distractin' me, go chop dem troys!
Har har, I did beet ya. You ain't gat no skiws.
I will beat you eventually!
Oh ah. Come on nen.
I give up.
Ah new ya wud. Best ya gow back den.
Wew done. I see you do have a good command ov yur abilitoys.
Remember this, yow need to know wot you can do so ya know what to learn. Now off ya go!
I went to an area where I had to cut down trees as fast as I could! I had to do it against another man, and he kept asking me questions on what I could achieve.
And your thoughts on its meaning?
This is tricky. I think it was showing the importance of being able to know your own abilities and having confidence in them. You need this to beat opposition in whatever form that
might present itself.
I am very impressed.
This looks like an interesting island.
Oh it is.
Fancy a race!?!
What? That's a bit sudden. What kind of race?
I bet I can beat you to the other end of this island, I'll take the left route and you can take the right.
That doesn't seem fair - mine's all curvy and yours is straight.
Well, that's life I'm afraid, it's never as easy as you would like, you have to take the path that's dealt!
If you insist.
You'll see, so how about it?
Have it your way.
Oh, hello? Looks like you'll probably want to start again.
You beat me.
Woo hoo! Ha ha! You can try again if you want, but you'll never beat me, I'm far too fast!
Eat my dust!
You're right, I'm far too slow.
You give up too easily, but have it your way.
I won!
Noooo! How could you beat me?
Very well.
I'm just making the most of the abilities I worked hard to develop. That's all!
True. A very important thing to remember! Now be gone!

I found myself on a sort of race course, facing an opponent. He had a straight route to travel, but mine was weaving and littered with obstacles. He had it easy and I seemed to have the hard route. But I still beat
him.
And what lesson do you suppose that teaches?

I had the more difficult path to travel, but I was faster and wanted it more - I hurried through while he just walked. That shows a few things, not all paths are easy to take, but if you want to succeed, and are willing to
put in the effort you can come out successful.
Very, very good!
Hello there. What's going on here?
This is too weird. I...caaannooot....uuunnnnderstaaaand...youuuu!
Oh sorry. I'm not 7676908 used 768 to speaking 1324719 like this. It's not 90181 easy 901823 890 to talk 13127 without 90809 saying 90789 numbers.
That's ok. So what is the point of this place?
I dunno. Fancy a 4354353 game? Try and 353 complete these 43553 43543 sequences using 56367 the numbers around 24757 27 you! You will have to tell me the next two numbers in the sequence.
Erm, ok, I can't turn down an offer in this place.
What was the sequence again?
What am I supposed to be doing?
Try and 295621 complete the sequences 2428428 I tell you using 792682 the numbers around 2 45785 57637 you!
That's not it, we shall 324234 have to start 324 again. Try a new sequence!
That's correct! 96973 Onto the next 112908 number in the sequence!
So far we have the sequence:
That's it! You've completed. More to go. Time for 324324 the next sequence!
That's it! I think 34132421 you've got 12341 the hang of 124151 this now!
Phew!
Please remember this: You must 23235 be able to 23526 communicate and understand 26243 others, they 2627422 have wisdom and 4363472 experiences to 235725 share!
Yeah, yeah. What now?
Off you go!
I went to this area where I had to play this strange game involving numbers. I had to understand what this guy was saying, but he was mainly talking in numbers. It was most weird.
And did you learn anything from this? What do you suppose this part of your dream was trying to tell you?
To me it was about trying to understand someone else to proceed I suppose.
Exactly. By understanding others around you and through communication with your surroundings you can in turn learn a great deal about yourself.
Follow my lead!
Huh, wait a sec, who are...
See what you will learn! Tee hee hee.
You're not all there are you?
Hey! This is your dream!
So what do you say?
Suppose I may as well have a go.
Follow!
I think i'll pass.
Oh, that's no fun.
NO no no!
Well done!
Woo hoo!
That's it!
Nice one!
Yep, you've got it!
You soon picked that up! Can you see how important it is to be able to communicate and relate with others? You can gain a lot of knowledge from it.
I see. There's a lot more to communication than words. Thank you.
Ok, back you go!

I found myself meeting a man that only seemed to interact using body language. I basically mimicked what he was doing and before I knew what was happening, it felt like we were friends. It was very strange.
That's dreams for you. But there must have been some logic behind it!

Yeah, I think it was illustrating the importance of being able to relate to others, and that a great deal of thoughts and emotions are shared between people. We can learn a lot from each other, so I suppose friend
relations are important.
That seems about right to me.
Let's have a game, ! It's a game of luck! Or is it...
Hahaha!
Erm... I'm scared. What?

Look around and you'll see a selection of dice. I will call out a number. You must then roll over the dice to get the top faces adding up to create that number. For example. If I said '15', you'd have to turn over the dice
to get the following numbers at the top: 6 + 4 + 2 + 1 + 1 + 1 = 15. There are of course many ways to get the number 15, but the dice are perhaps not all that random!
Ok...
The number you want is:
What lucky question will I get?
What number am I trying to make up?
The number !

Look around and you'll see a selection of dice. What I will do is call out a number. You must then roll over the dice to get the top faces adding up to create that number. For example. If I said '15', you'd have to turn
over the dice to get the following numbers at the top: 6 + 4 + 2 + 1 + 1 + 1 = 15. There are of course many ways to get the number 15, but the dice are perhaps not all that random!
Well Done! The next number is:

You've done it! Good work. Remember: It is important to respect that luck plays a part in things, but that doesn't mean there is not reason and logic behind your surroundings. If you look hard enough you can see the
reason.
Ok. Thanks!
Ok, back you go!
I visited this strange platform covered in dice. I was then challenged to turn over selected dice in what seemed like a game of chance. But I think there was some logic behind it all.
What do you suppose that means then?
Got it! You have to appreciate that there is always a certain level of the unknown in life, but there is always an answer, you just have to play the game and have hope that you'll succeed.
Spot on.
You know everything is a journey!
A journey? Don't talk to me about journeys! I'm surprised I have any feet left with all the walking I have to do!
I know. I know. But at every step, it was important that you knew where you had been, where you were and where you were headed.
To be honest, I spend a lot of my time not knowing a single one of those things!
Let's see how you fare in here. Try and get to the other side and you'll see what I mean.
Well done! So tell me, what have you learned?

I think I understand better now, it is very useful to be able to remember where you have been, where you are and where you are headed. I needed all three to progress, unless I worked with trial and error, which
you do sometimes have to do I suppose when looking into the future as the future is undecided.
Very deep! Excellent, I'm glad you learnt something. I shall send you back!

I went to this place with loads of platforms. I had to jump across them, but some of them weren't real and I fell away as I stepped on them. I had to remember where I was on the grid, and recall the route I was
taking.
Interesting. Do you have any interpretations?
I suppose there is a great deal of importance in knowing where you are and where you are going. Having goals and remembering your past. It helps you make the right decisions!
Bingo!

That's it! You've learnt the 6 core lessons: Make sense of others to understand yourself, you must be able to relate to others, you must use your abilities to progress, you must be aware of your past and
present to help you in the future, you must harness your confidence, and you must appreciate the unknown.
Excellent. Now what?
There is one more challenge you must face. I can't tell you what to expect, you are still being tested.
Would you like to face your final challenge?
Of course. I'm ready.
I'm not ready yet, give me a little more time.

Hello again. So you have learnt the 6 core lessons: Make sense of others to understand yourself, you must be able to relate to others, you must use your abilities to progress, you must be aware of your past and
present to help you in the future, you must harness your confidence, and you must appreciate the unknown. Because magic is within, by understanding these lessons you can access the power of the moon
clan. You are almost finished here. There is one more challenge which you must face.
I don't suppose you can give me any help?
Sorry. So how about it, are you ready?
I've completed a few tasks in the dreamland! I've learned a variety of things. But I've still got one last thing to do.
Well best you return and do that before you tell me what you have learned. I'd rather you learn all you can before you talk to me about it.
OK.
I did it! I confronted myself!
Well done, I think your lesson is complete, best you wake yourself up! Go read the book on the lectern.
I've done it! I understand now!
You do, I'm not sure I believe you. Tell me what you've learnt.

To start with, six very important things that I needed to know of myself: Make sense of others to understand yourself, you must be able to relate to others, you must use your abilities to progress, you must be aware of
your past and present to help you in the future, you must harness your confidence, and you must appreciate the unknown.

That's great! I would never have imagined someone from mainland could have had such an open mind to learn such things! I shall spread the word among our people. After this I can't see why we can't start to get
along.
Excellent. I think if you make contact with the Fremennik, and tell them your willingness to communicate and share, you'll find plenty of eager ears.

Well done! You must be rewarded for this great deed. You're now more than welcome to use the altar behind me to craft the astral runes that we use here on the island. These runes will allow you to use a new set of
spells. Simply pray at the altar behind me to gain the knowledge.
Hi, how are things going?

Well hopefully a lot better now that you've initiated the calm between the Moon Clan and the Fremenniks. Remember, if you want to use our Lunar Spells at any time, pray at the altar beside me and you can modify
your knowledge!
Well if it isn't. I've heard of your exploits in the Lunar Isles!
Already? News really does travel fast!
Thank you so very much, I think we can really make progress now.
No worries. I am pleased I could help.
Oh, erm, could you help me out with a Seal of Passage?
Seal of Passage, well I suppose so.
Ok, here you go.

characters.name: 'Beedy-eye' Jones
characters.description: Middle-aged male, gruff British accent, intense and watchful personality, a pirate known for his piercing stare.

characters.name: 'Beefy' Burns
characters.description: Middle-aged male, British accent, irritable and opinionated tone, the ship's cook with an obsessive hatred of vegetables and strict hygiene standards.

characters.name: 'Beefy' Burns/'Eagle-eye' Shultz
characters.description: Middle-aged male, British accent, irritable and opinionated tone, the ship's cook with an obsessive hatred of vegetables and strict hygiene standards.

characters.name: 'Betty' B.Boppin
characters.description: Young adult male, British accent, chatty and excitable personality, a pirate who never stops talking about someone named Betty.

characters.name: 'Bird's-Eye' Jack
characters.description: Middle-aged male, British accent, calm and competent tone, a skilled pirate navigator who later becomes a banker on Lunar Isle.

characters.name: 'Birds-Eye' Jack
characters.description: Middle-aged male, British accent, calm and competent tone, a skilled pirate navigator who later becomes a banker on Lunar Isle.

characters.name: 'Eagle-eye' Shultz
characters.description: Middle-aged male, British accent, observant and alert personality, the ship's lookout stationed at the bow with his telescope.

characters.name: 'Lecherous' Lee
characters.description: Middle-aged male, rough British accent, deceptively soft-hearted despite his ruthless reputation, secretly fond of kittens.

characters.name: 'Lecherous' Lee/'Sticky' Sanders
characters.description: Middle-aged male, rough British accent, deceptively soft-hearted despite his ruthless reputation, secretly fond of kittens.

characters.name: 'Picarron' Pete
characters.description: Middle-aged male, gruff British accent, thoroughly committed to the pirate lifestyle, a rogue through and through.

characters.name: 'Sticky' Sanders
characters.description: Young adult male, British accent, laid-back and easygoing personality, a pirate known for his fondness of jam.

characters.name: Baba Yaga
characters.description: Elderly female, Eastern European accent with a raspy voice, eccentric and admittedly insane, a witch who lives in a chicken-legged house.

characters.name: Bedread the bold
characters.description: Middle-aged male, British accent, surprisingly bookish for a pirate, ironically named for his hobby of reading about beds.

characters.name: Brundt the Chieftain
characters.description: Mature male, Nordic accent, stern and authoritative tone, the proud chieftain of Rellekka who maintains Fremennik traditions.

characters.name: Cabin boy
characters.description: Youthful male, British accent, naive and easily manipulated, a junior crew member who was tricked by a Moon Clan girl.

characters.name: Captain Bentley
characters.description: Middle-aged male, British accent with pirate swagger, pragmatic and morally flexible, the wooden-legged captain of the Lady Zay.

characters.name: Crewmember
characters.description: Adult male, British accent, straightforward and dutiful personality, a standard pirate sailor aboard the Lady Zay.

characters.name: Dream guide
characters.description: Ageless ethereal voice, mystical and otherworldly tone, a spiritual guide who helps navigate the dream world.

characters.name: Ethereal Being
characters.description: Ageless ethereal voice, mysterious and philosophical tone, guides players through the dream world with existential wisdom.

characters.name: Ethereal Expert
characters.description: Adult male ethereal voice, confident and challenging tone, the master of accomplishment who oversees the racing challenge.

characters.name: Ethereal Fluke
characters.description: Adult male ethereal voice, playful and whimsical tone, a spirit associated with luck who runs games of chance.

characters.name: Ethereal Guide
characters.description: Adult male ethereal voice, patient and instructional tone, a mysterious guide who knows past, present, and future.

characters.name: Ethereal Mimic
characters.description: Playful ethereal voice, imitative and energetic personality, challenges players to copy emotes in the dream world.

characters.name: Ethereal Numerator
characters.description: Adult male ethereal voice, precise and teacher-like tone, reminiscent of a strict mathematics instructor.

characters.name: Ethereal Perceptive
characters.description: Adult male ethereal voice, knowing and perceptive tone, challenges players to a log-cutting competition.

characters.name: First mate 'Davey-boy'
characters.description: Middle-aged male, British accent with a by-the-book personality, the regulation-citing first mate who maintains the ship's magical runes.

characters.name: First mate 'Davey-boy'/'Picarron' Pete
characters.description: Middle-aged male, British accent with a by-the-book personality, the regulation-citing first mate who maintains the ship's magical runes.

characters.name: Jack Sails
characters.description: Middle-aged male, British accent, straightforward and practical personality, a bearded pirate crew member.

characters.name: Jenny Blade
characters.description: Adult female, British accent, confident and notorious, an infamous pirate who claims both her eyes are glass.

characters.name: Lokar Searunner
characters.description: Middle-aged male, British accent, pragmatic and adventurous, a former Fremennik who became a pirate to escape the boring village life.

characters.name: Meteora
characters.description: Adult female, heavy Cockney rhyming slang accent making her difficult to understand, a Moon Clan member known for her distinctive speech.

characters.name: Murky Pat
characters.description: Middle-aged male, British accent, menacing and intimidating tone, a dangerous pirate you should never look in the eyes.

characters.name: Oneiromancer
characters.description: Adult female, mystical and authoritative British accent, the mind-reading spiritual leader of the Moon Clan.

characters.name: Parrot
characters.description: High-pitched squawky voice, excitable and random, Captain Bentley's pet bird that references movies.

characters.name: Pauline Polaris
characters.description: Adult female, mysterious British accent with a knowing tone, a Moon Clan member who chose a new name to escape her past.

characters.name: Rimae Sirsalis
characters.description: Elderly female, British accent, matter-of-fact personality, a bald Moon Clan tanner with distinctive warts.

characters.name: Selene
characters.description: Adult female, dreamy British accent, contemplative and ethereal personality, a Moon Clan member lost in her own world.

characters.name: Tommy 2-times
characters.description: Adult male, British accent, mysterious personality, a pirate whose nickname origin remains unknown.
